title: not supported ATM to reference additional remotes [network.py:as_git_url:782] (NotImplementedError)
body:
#### What is the problem?
`datalad install` does not work
#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
```
me@christop ~ $ datalad search NSF
No DataLad dataset found at current location
Would you like to install the DataLad superdataset at 'C:\\Users\\me\\datalad'? (choices: yes, no): ERROR:
Interrupted by user while doing magic: KeyboardInterrupt() [getpass.py:win_getpass:110]
me@christop ~ $ cd /c/stanford_gdrive/data/
me@christop /c/stanford_gdrive/data $ datalad search NSF
No DataLad dataset found at current location
Would you like to install the DataLad superdataset at 'C:\\Users\\me\\datalad'? (choices: yes, no):
[INFO] Cloning http://datasets.datalad.org/ to 'C:\Users\me\datalad'
From now on you can refer to this dataset using the label '///'
[INFO] Performing search using DataLad superdataset 'C:\\Users\\me\\datalad'
[INFO] Reached the limit of 20 top matches, there could be more which were not reported.
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\crcns\cai-2 (dataset)
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\crcns\hc-11 (dataset)
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\hbnssi (dataset)
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\labs\haxby\attention (dataset)
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\labs\haxby\life (dataset)
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\openfmri\ds000001 (dataset)
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\openfmri\ds000002 (dataset)
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\openfmri\ds000003 (dataset)
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\openfmri\ds000005 (dataset)

search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\openfmri\ds000007 (dataset)
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\openfmri\ds000008 (dataset)
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\openfmri\ds000011 (dataset)
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\openfmri\ds000017 (dataset)
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\openfmri\ds000030 (dataset)
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\openfmri\ds000051 (dataset)
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\openfmri\ds000052 (dataset)
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\openfmri\ds000101 (dataset)
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\openfmri\ds000102 (dataset)
search(ok): C:\Users\me\datalad\openfmri\ds000105 (dataset)
action summary:
  search (ok: 20)
me@christop /c/stanford_gdrive/data $ datalad install ///openfmri/ds000002
[ERROR] not supported ATM to reference additional remotes [network.py:as_git_url:782] (NotImplementedError)
```
#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?
```
me@christop /c/stanford_gdrive/data $ datalad wtf

=======

======

===========

PATH='c:\\users\\me\\miniconda3\\Library\\bin;C:\\Users\\me\\bin;C:\\Program Files\\Git\\mingw64\\bin;C:\\Program Files\\Git\\usr\\local\\bin;C:\\Program Files\\Git\\usr\\bin;C:\\Program Files\\Git\\usr\\bin;C:\\Program Files\\Git\\cmd;C:\\Program Files\\ConEmu\\ConEmu\\Scripts;C:\\Program Files\\ConEmu;C:\\Program Files\\ConEmu\\ConEmu;C:\\Program Files\\NVIDIA GPU Computing Components\\iCLS;C:\\Windows\\system32;C:\\Windows;C:\\Windows\\System32\\Wbem;C:\\Windows\\System32\\WindowsPowerShell\\v1.0;C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Intel\\Intel(R) Management Engine Components\\DAL;C:\\Program Files\\Intel\\Intel(R) Management Engine Components\\DAL;C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Intel\\Intel(R) Management Engine Components\\IPT;C:\\Program Files\\Intel\\Intel(R) #### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
```
I'm using 64bit installation of Git which is theoretically discouraged (at least it used to be).

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)
You and me go way back.
